name: plash
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I ] (of a liquid) to make a noise when moving or hitting something: The only sound was the fountain plashing away. Lazy ripples plashed lightly on the sand. Synonym
splash

[ T ]
  agriculture
  UK specialized to twist branches together in a line of trees or a hedge (= a line of bushes planted very close together, especially along the edge of a garden, field, or road): One of the labourers was plashing a hedge. Plashed hedges stand as monuments to the best traditions of good husbandry. Synonym
pleach
the sound of water moving or hitting something: The heat of the sun and plash of water made her sleepy. All you could hear was the plash and churn of the water around their ankles. Synonym
splash
